answers.answer: Did you get your blood sugar levels checked?  If not, you should.  In some people developing diabetes type 2, they get the "shakes" when their blood sugar drops.  This can be an indication of development of diabetes.  Please go see a doctor and get blood tested for that.

question: Hey I'm 21 years old and I never really drink . Probably once every 4 months type of thing . But I am now starting to realize I shake really bad after I had a drink or two . Not right away but like a few hours later . I shake really bad , my hands , chest , arms , legs everything . I cant stop!! Its starting to scare me because this has never happened before . I'm really confused if I need to seek help on this . I shake for a good 30 mins non stop . I was almost in tears because I didn't know what was going on with me ! To be honest I went on Google and typed in "shaking after drinking" but all that pops up is people who have been drinking a lot , In my case i only had 2 small drinks . PLEASE HELP
title: shaking badly after drinking
